Prerequisites: ACG2021; ACG2071 (STUDENTS MUST HAVE COMPLETED ACG 2021 AND ACG 2071, WITH A GRADE OF “B” OR BETTER (“B-” IS NOT ACCEPTABLE). STUDENTS MUST ALSO RECEIVE A GRADE
Course Description: IN-DEPTH STUDY OF FINANCIAL-REPORTING CONCEPTS AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED PRACTICE, INCLUDING AN OVERVIEW OF THE ACCOUNTING-CYCLE ASSETS AND NONCURRENT ASSETS. EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON ANALYZING FINANCIAL EVENTS AND THE CONSEQUENCES OF FINANCIAL-REPORTING ALTERNATIVES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.   IDENTIFY, DISCUSS, AND EXAMINE THE FUNCTIONS, PRACTICES, LIMITATIONS, AND CHALLENGES OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING.
2.   READ, SYNTHESIZE, AND ANALYZE THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF BUSINESS ENTITIES.
3.   PREPARE JOURNAL ENTRIES AND ANALYZE THEIR EFFECT ON FIRMS’ FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. 
4.   PREPARE BASIC FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPROPRIATE STANDARDS. 
5.   DEMONSTRATE A FOUNDATIONAL-LEVEL KNOWLEDGE OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING THAT WILL ENABLE FURTHER LEARNING IN MORE ADVANCED ACCOUNTING AND BUSINESS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
